001package edu.pdx.cs410J.whitlock;
002
003import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;
004import org.junit.jupiter.api.Disabled;
005import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
006
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008
009import static org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat;
010import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.containsString;
011import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.startsWith;
012import static org.hamcrest.core.IsEqual.equalTo;
013import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.fail;
014
015/**
016 * Unit tests for the Student class.  In addition to the JUnit annotations,
017 * they also make use of the <a href="http://hamcrest.org/JavaHamcrest/">hamcrest</a>
018 * matchers for more readable assertion statements.
019 */
020public class StudentTest
021{
022
023  private Student dave;
024
025  @BeforeEach
026  void createDaveStudent() throws InvalidGpaException, InvalidGenderException {
027    ArrayList<String> classes = new ArrayList<>();
028    classes.add("Algorithms");
029    classes.add("Operating Systems");
030    classes.add("Java");
031    this.dave = new Student("Dave", classes, 3.64, "male");
032  }
033
034  @Test
035  void studentNamedPatIsNamedPat() throws InvalidGpaException, InvalidGenderException {
036    // GIVEN: I've created a Student with a name of "Pat"
037    String name = "Pat";
038    var pat = new Student(name, new ArrayList<>(), 0.0, "Doesn't matter");
039
040    // WHEN: I get the Student's name
041    // THEN: The name is "Pat"
042    assertThat(pat.getName(), equalTo(name));
043  }
044
045  @Test
046  void studentWithGpaGreaterThan4ThrowsInvalidGpaException() throws InvalidGenderException {
047    // GIVEN: A student named "Sharon" who is
048    //        taking "Java" and "Front End"
049    //        has a GPA of 5.00
050    //        has a "female" gender
051    ArrayList<String> classes = new ArrayList<>();
052    classes.add("Java");
053    classes.add("Front End");
054
055    // WHEN: That student is created
056    // THEN: A InvalidGpaException is thrown
057    try {
058      new Student("Sharon", classes, 5.0, "female");
059      fail("Should have thrown an InvalidGpaException");
060
061    } catch (InvalidGpaException ex) {
062      // We expect this exception
063    }
064  }
065
066  @Disabled
067  @Test
068  void daveStudentFromTheAssignment() {
069    assertThat(dave.toString(), equalTo("Dave has a GPA of 3.64 and is taking 3 classes: Algorithms, Operating Systems, and Java.  He says \"This class is too much work\"."));
070  }
071
072  @Test
073  void allStudentsSayThisClassIsTooMuchWork() {
074    assertThat(dave.says(), equalTo("This class is too much work"));
075  }
076
077  @Test
078  void toStringContainsStudentName() {
079    assertThat(dave.toString(), startsWith("Dave"));
080  }
081
082  @Test
083  void toStringContainsGpa() {
084    assertThat(dave.toString(), containsString("has a GPA of 3.64"));
085  }
086
087  @Disabled
088  @Test
089  void toStringContainsTheNumberOfClasses() {
090    assertThat(dave.toString(), containsString("3"));
091  }
092
093  @Test
094  void nullGenderThrowsInvalidGenderException() throws InvalidGpaException {
095    try {
096      new Student("Name", new ArrayList<>(), 3.5, null);
097      fail("Should have thrown an InvalidGenderException");
098
099    } catch (InvalidGenderException ex) {
100      // We expect this
101    }
102  }
103
104}
